title: How to nerf Devourer fairly

replies.body: Should have a cap of AS gained otherwise someone who keeps farming would just build like 4 Infinity Edge's and rek.
I feel like it was implied that it capped at Sated. If it wasn't, I sincerely apologize. It would cap at 50%, its live number.
honestly they would have to buff it significantly if it gave no stats on purchase
I reckon make it have 20% base attack speed and just have it gain 1% attack speed per stack
20% base attack speed and 1% per stack is actually a really smart balance between the two.

See, you have to wait until mid-circlejerk, when it's first released everyone is having too much fun with it to want it nerfed. Now, though everyone's sick of it.

Hell no i like to literally destroy everything in my path without giving my enemies time to think about all of the wrong decisions they've made in their life and forever give them the Vietnam Flashback effect anytime they hear or see someone with the almighty Sated Devourer.

I have a better idea:

#Devourer

* **Stats:** +40% attack speed, +20 on-hit magic damage
* **Passive:** Unchanged however stacks now grants additional bonusses between
 * **10 stacks:** +10% attackspeed
 * **20 stacks:** +15 on-hit magic damage
 * **30 stacks:** transforms into Sated Devourer
   * **UNIQUE Passive - PHANTOM HIT:** Every 3th basic attack will be a phantom attack that triggers on-hit effects twice.
That would actually give more early game boosts. Attack speed isn't great early, but on-hit damage is. The raw stats Devourer would give would actually get better from that.
The current devour gives +50% attack speed, +30 on-hit magic damage...
You know, I'm an idiot XD. Thanks for correcting me.
I don't dislike, but you're putting an even greater onus on scuttle-dragon control. They simply give too many stacks.
True. I personally don't mind scuttler-dragon control being pushed for, as they are very important objectives, and they can be under-appreciated in Solo Queue.

And make it much harder to get stacks so a 1/0/1 Udyr doesn't get it at 18 minutes and destroy everything.
Well, lowering the early attack speed is lowering the early clear speed and gank potential.

I support this but I'm still not really satisfied with the change. Junglers like Udyr and Yi who have monstrous sustain/clear speed will still have no trouble sating or going in for a gank at full hp. Meanwhile the underdogs Shen, Jax, etc will suffer horribly from this change. That's not really a problem that can be fixed with the devourer though, so I guess I'm going off topic. I'd like for the blades to be exchangeable. Right now if you build ranger's trailblazer your smite is useless lategame, but some junglers really need it to be viable. If you could swap that out, lategame junglers like Jax, Wukong, etc would still be viable, but sating would be more fair.

If you could swap that out, lategame junglers like Jax, Wukong, etc would still be viable, but sating would be more fair.

I feel like then everybody would start trailblazer / sated, then swap out for challenging / sated.

But what's the issue with that? That's exactly what would help curb Udyr and Yi's strong presence early game. They usually buy chilling smite anyways. They don't need help clearing so they're building straight into chilling/skirmishing. The other junglers with poor clear can buy ranger's then skirmishers later. This would really just open up options for struggling junglers and not give anything to strong junglers like shyv udyr yi. I'd rather an Udyr clear slightly faster than be able to slow me so he can rip my face off.

I don't think that'd work very well mainly because losing the attack speed from the daggers/recurve bow doesn't make much sense. You'd need 18 stacks to catch back up to the attack speed you would have had if you hadn't upgraded to Devourer. At the very least, the item needs to give the 30% attack speed from the items it builds out of. CoolKnightST's idea makes a bit more sense in this regard.

I swear I didn't cheat off your post to make mine...

I think that's a great move, as I explained off my other post. However, gotta note:
1. The item needs something to get it running early during ganking (my vote: either MS or even a slight slow that builds to 16%ish), and
2. Rageblade needs to be reworked into something else anyway, and a new sub-item needs to be made to build into the both of them (since Rageblade costs more than the jungle item should on its own).

That said, this is the direction I want to go.

I love exaggerations.  It scales up, yes.  It's not unbeatable.  If you adjust your strategy accordingly, it's a reasonably balanced item.

I thought the funniest thing I'd seen is UoL who tried to Kayle mid with devourer.  It's not runeglaive OP and runeglaive wasn't that OP either.
It still gives a ton of power late, traded for slightly less damage early. If the early weakness was more pronounced, it would be a lot better imo. Kinda like the problem with Vayne.
It's just cancerous no matter which way you slice it. Just make it a regular AS+onhit item. Get rid of this extra bullshit stacking and double effects.

I would happily accept a reasonable nerf like this if it gave stacks for destroying towers. With Yi there are times when I solo kill 2 towers in a lane while the enemies are just dicking around trying to force a teamfight, and I gain no stacks from it.
I wouldn't mind this idea. It adds another reason for players to go for objectives.

I can understand your frustration with dealing with devourer junglers, or just the meta in it's current state, but this nerf is wayyy too harsh. It's supposed to be a late game item, which it is. If you want early game pressure, warrior or cinderhulk (or both, depending on the champ) are still better. This change would literally make it so that you're so useless that unless all of your lanes solo win the game is auto lost. Stacking that item from behind when you lose map control early is impossible. You don't get sated until post 30 minutes, if at all.

I can see what you mean. However, this is to pressure the entire team to get the Devourer Sated, either by getting scuttler/dragon or by counterjungling a lot. This is supposed to be a team game, and if the team isn't working together, you should lose. If the entire team works together to get this one carry ridiculously powerful, then you deserve to win. 

Additionally, it's like playing a match where Amumu is your jungler. Just assume you won't get ganks XD
Nah, lets jujst nerf cinderhulk and maybe warrior, that will fix devourer? Right guys? (Rito 2015)
Brilliant idea. Kudos.
Thanks. Means a lot to know one of my ideas isn't complete horse shit XD

Devourer is not supposed to be useless early and monstrous late. It is supposed to be balanced at every stage of the game. How to balance it? Remove Sated devourer, and let Devourer stack indefinitely instead.

Ummmmmm... I don't know about that. The Cinderhulk changes were based around Devourer being the premier late-game jungle item. Sated in its entirety is based around that notion. I don't know why you think that live Devourer is always supposed to be equally balanced at every stage.

> [{quoted}](name=TurquoiseYoshi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=d0AgYxAe,comment-id=000f0000,timestamp=2015-08-23T03:44:38.189+0000)
>
> Ummmmmm... I don't know about that. The Cinderhulk changes were based around Devourer being the premier late-game jungle item. Sated in its entirety is based around that notion. I don't know why you think that live Devourer is always supposed to be equally balanced at every stage.

It doesn't make sence, to force a class of champions to be late game focused, because of their type of damage application (Autoattacks) and their position (Jungle). 

Devourer does stack, but other items do get stronger too (Botrk because enemys get more and more health, Rabadons because you get more and more AP etc.). And other jungle items get stronger in the late game too: Cinderhulk has %-health-amplification, Runeglaive has an AP scaling, Warriors armor penetration scales with damage from other items. So that Devourer gets better is not really special. It is just that the idea of Sated Devourer is insane and stupid. Champions with built in on hit effects benefit way too much. Almost everyone is forced to build Botrk seconds, because it is op, there is no build diversity, and overall sated devourer is too strong in the late game.

It means you dont get it immediately.  It takes probably 10-15 minutes to get.
